document_data.name: City of Phoenix
document_data.mainbody: The '''City of Phoenix''', once '''Carthag''', was an ancient city in [[Raurin]], which was known for its luxurious resorts, houses of rest and restoration; this led to its later renaming. As the desertification of Raurin continued, the city was first protected with an enchanted dome, and then finally abandoned; the archmage [[Martek]] chose to hide the prison of the [[djinni]] vizier [[Aeraldoth]] there.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|86}}
document_data.Location: Though only {{SI|20|miles|k|long=yes}} east-northeast of the [[Oasis of the White Palm]], the City of Carthag was separated from it by a chain of rocky mountains.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|145}} The City lay in a low-lying bowl, at least {{SI|40|miles|k|long=yes}} in diameter, where no wind could reach; this made the temperatures stay frightfully high during the night and outright deadly by day, from {{SI|150|F}} to {{SI|180|F}} at times.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|32}}{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|87}}
document_data.Structure:
The city of Phoenix had some structures visible from the tops of dunes {{SI|20|miles|k|long=yes}} away. Most who entered would do so through a pitfall, which would deposit them somewhere in the streets below. Some of those pitfalls led into glassy smooth tubes, which had been created by a [[beholder]] in service of [[Khalitharius]], aiming to find victims to capture and convert to the cause amongst those who were caught in Phoenix's pitfalls.

The city itself was silent and still, save for the sand still filtering through gaps in the magical dome; it had accumulated too high to see the tops, as there was just about no light in there. Most of the visible buildings were white marble.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|89}}{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|90}} the [[home of Chininsk Ambar]]{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|91}}{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|92}}, and the [[Baths of Garimsharr]]. A nonfunctional sewer tunnel connected the baths to the Statue of Set. The Baths of Garimsharr made for an improvised road to a statue of [[Set]], where the djinn Aeraldoth was bound in a bottle hidden within the statue.
document_data.Defenses: The heat was outright deadly during the day in a radius of {{SI|20|miles|k|long=yes}} forcing most travelers to make do by night; even then, the superheated sand remained painful to walk on, and it was so fine that it created a risk of sinkholes even then. A {{SI|1|mile|k|long=yes}} radius dome protected the city, only the tops of the highest towers poking out through; the dome was broken in places, and the gaps could function as sinkholes for unwary travelers.
document_data.Inhabitants:
The area around Phoenix was uninhabitable by day. All life in the area emerged by night to hunt, including [[purple worm]]s, [[roc|giant rocs]], [[snake|krite snakes]], [[giant centipede|centipedes]], [[huge spider|huge trap-door spiders]], [[hyena]]s, [[jackal]]s, [[giant ant]]s and [[beetle|giant beetles]]. Spectral apparitions like those in Southern Raurin existed as well, and they led travelers towards the center of Phoenix.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|86-87}}

The fauna was very different inside the city. There were a number of permanent residents, including [[rust monster]]s, [[red spider|red spiders]], [[desert tick|desert ticks]], [[fire ant]]s, [[carrion beetle]]s, [[poisonous snake|krite]], and strangely enough, the [[skeleton]]s of adventurers who cursed their gods as they died here. After the release of [[Khalitharius]], a [[beholder]] under his orders had come to sift for possible servants in the ruins.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|88}}
